label: Description
value: Wallpaper designed for the French Revolution, illustrated with oak leaf wreath enclosing crossed fasces, sword & Phrygian cap. Tricolor ribbons wrapped around fluted column bear legend: "Soyons Unis/Nous Serons/Invincibles."

label: Credit line
value: Gift of John Jay Ide Collection

label: Notes
value: Wallpaper designed for the French Revolution, illustrated with oak leaf wreath enclosing crossed fasces, sword & Phrygian cap. Tricolor ribbons wrapped around fluted column bear legend: "Soyons Unis/Nous Serons/Invincibles."

label: Description
value: Rectangular molded tile with high relief border surrounding female figure in Renaissance costume, holding falcon on arm and with hunting dog at feet.Figure stands before draped wall. Thick transparent ochre glaze creates highlights and shadows around relief details.

label: Description
value: Square tile, molded with relief bust of Walt Whitman within a circular frame, which floral corners. Glazed overall in transparent sage green, highly cracked.

label: Description
value: Vase with curved, pear-shaped profile and broad flaring lip.  Body of brown, beige, blue and white mottled and wedged stoneware to create overall marbled effect.  Unglazed.

label: Description
value: Oval tubular etui. Sheath closure. Case (a) with retangular form, plain panels with bright-cut borders. At upper end a band of chased "s" scrolls and green gold leaves at top of each panel. Shallow flute in each panel. Bottom with engraved seal with coat of arms, unidentified. Cover (b) with similar decoration. Domed top with swirled rosette of green gold leaves.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Jean and Martin Gerstell

label: Description
value: Footed bulbous jar in green with allover darker green leaf pattern, overlaid with gilt silhouetted cats and figures. Jar has scrolled and foliate feet; C-curved hands.

label: Description
value: Oval bowl. Matte gilded obverse and reverse. Edge fluted in shell-like manner. Flat stem tapered toward end. Bright-cut engraved border: centralportion of stem engraved with asymmetrical pattern of overlapping triangleswith large plain section near end of handle. Oval bowl. Matte gilded obverse and reverse. Edge fluted in shell-like manner. Flat stem tapered outwarde toward end. Bright-cut engraved borderwith central panel of stem engraved with asymmetrical pattern of overlapping triangles, with large plain section near end of handle.

label: Description
value: Oval bowl. Matte gilded obverse and reverse. Edge fluted in shell-like manner. Flat stem tapered toward end. Bright-cut engraved stem: ovarall pattern of interlocking diagonal lines encircling demi-rosettes. Oval bowl. Matte gilded obverse and reverse. Edge fluted in shell-like manner. Flat stem tapered outward toward end. Stem bright-cut with over- all pattern of interlocking diagonal lines enclosing demi-rosettes.

label: Description
value: Rectangular box with maroon velvet on top and sides. Faded maroon plain fabric on underside. Two metal (brass?) security closures at front, two small hinges at back. Inside base lined in shirred blue satin with shaped "backbone" to hold 12 spoons. Inside cover with floral brocade in red and blue, and shirred yellow satin in two rectangles. Rectangular box with maroon velvet on top and sides. Faded maroon plain fabric underside. Two metal (brass?) security closures at front, and two small hinges at back. Inside base lined in shirred blue satin with shaped "backbone" to hold 12 spoons (two lacking in set). Inside case cover with floral brocade in red and blue, and shirred yellow satin in two rectangles.

label: Description
value: Bowl of spoon elongated oval, gilded, with band of fine bright-cut zig-zag engraving at inside lip. Connected to stem of square section, twisted to create spiral. Finial of flattened spherical turned button with central bead. Stem and finial of plain silver. Bowl of spoon of elongated oval shape, gilded, with band of fine zig-zag bright-cut engraving at inside lip of bowl. Stem of square section, twisted one to create spiral. Finial of flattened spherical turned button with central bead. Stem and finial of plain silver.

label: Description
value: Oval bowl, plain, gilded and undecorated. Stem of triangular section, flatsection at bottom. Annular joint at bowl. Slipped (cut at angle) end. Stem of plain silver. Plain matte gilded oval bowl, undecorated. Stem of triangular section, with flat section at bottom. annual joining at bowl. Slipped (cut at angle) end. Stem of plain silver.

label: Description
value: Oval bowl, plain, gilded and undecorated. Stem of triangular section, flatsection at bottom. Annular joint at bowl. Slipped (cut at angle) end. Stem of plain silver. Plain matte gilded oval bowl, undecorated. Stem of triangular section, with flat section at bottom. annual joining at bowl. Slipped (cut at angle) end. Stem of plain silver.

label: Description
value: Pointed oval bowl, matte gilded. Repousse anthemion pattern in bowl. Twisted stem of plain silver. Plain spherical finial. Pionted oval bowl, matte gilded. Respousse anthemion in bowl. Twisted stem of plain silver with plain spherical finial.

label: Description
value: Pointed oval bowl, matte gilded. Repousse anthemion pattern in bowl. Twisted stem of plain silver. Plain spherical finial. Pionted oval bowl, matte gilded. Respousse anthemion in bowl. Twisted stem of plain silver with plain spherical finial.

label: Description
value: Pointed oval bowl, matte gilded obverse and reverse. In bowl, bright-cut engraving ornament of vaguely Japanese inspiration, an articulated chevron. Stem of square section, twisted. Finial of flattened spherical turned but-ton with central bead. Stem and finial of plain silver. Pointed oval bowl. Matte gilded obverse and reverse. In bowl, bright-cut engraving of vaguely Japanese inspiration of an articulated chevron patternStem of square section, twisted to form spiral. Finial of flattened spher-ical turned button with central bead. Stem and finial of plain silver.

label: Description
value: Square, spade-shaped bowl. Matte gilded obverse and reverse. Bowl with bright-cut engraving of Japanese design: two interlocking semicircular mo- tifs. Stem of square section. Fluted pointed acorn-shaped finial. Stem and finial of plain silver. Square spade-shaped bowl. Matte gilded obverse and reverse. Bowl bright-cut engraved with Japanese design: two interlocking semicirular motifs at upper left corner. Stem of square section. Fluted pointed acorn-shaped finial. Stem and finial of plain silver.

label: Description
value: Square, spade-shaped bowl. Matte gilded obverse and reverse. Bowl with bright-cut engraving of Japanese design: two interlocking semicircular mo- tifs. Stem of square section. Fluted pointed acorn-shaped finial. Stem and finial of plain silver. Square spade-shaped bowl. Matte gilded obverse and reverse. Bowl bright-cut engraved with Japanese design: two interlocking semicirular motifs at upper left corner. Stem of square section. Fluted pointed acorn-shaped finial. Stem and finial of plain silver.

label: Description
value: Velvet panel bound on four sides with a striped floral patterned silk. The velvet is patterned with rows of men standing, seated cross-legged, and confronted seated on chairs with birds, in a garden. In light blue and ivory pile on a pale yellow pile foundation.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk Technique: supplementary warp pile (velvet) in a 3&1 twill foundation Label: silk velvet in twill foundation

label: Dimensions
value: H x W: 61 x 54.9 cm (24 x 21 5/8 in.) Repeat H x W: 16.8 x 5.4 cm (6 5/8 x 2 1/8 in.)

label: Description
value: Circular molded plate with broad rim painted in purple ground with continuous enameled and gilded floral swags in blue, pink, and green, with gilded scallops. Center with floral border, gilded edge, and central spray of roses against purple ground.

label: Physical description
value: soft paste porcelain, vitreous enamel, gold

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. John Jay Ide; 1986: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Length of damask used to protect carpeting on stairs during summer. Pattern of offset leaves with berries framed by flowers forming a lattice. This pattern fills the 42.5 cm (16 3/4 in.) central section. Border on both sides, mirror images of each other, 7.5 cm (3 in.) wide with simple fret and dotted guards. Brown warp and ivory weft.

label: Physical description
value: Technique: Jacquard woven. 4 & 1 satin damask. Weft float face interruption, 1. Warp float face interruption, 2.

label: Dimensions
value: Warp x Weft: 663 x 61 cm (21 ft. 9 in. x 24 in.) Pattern repeat H x W: 25 x 19.5 cm (9 13/16 x 7 11/16 in.)
